alert.note: Alert for Boise Mountains; Lower Treasure Valley (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 6:24PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Ada, west central Boise and southeastern Gem Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 624 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Eagle, or 8 miles southeast of Emmett, moving northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Ada, west central Boise and southeastern Gem Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
